# zFar

**Instance Property**

The orthogonal plane of the shadow frustum that’s furthest from the spotlight.

## Declaration

```swift
var zFar: SpotLightComponent.Shadow.ShadowClippingPlane { get set }
```

## Discussion

The `zFar` is the maximum distance between the light and a visible surface for casting shadows.

The spotlight applies the value from [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SpotLightComponent/attenuationRadius], when you set this property to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SpotLightComponent/Shadow/ShadowClippingPlane/automatic], which is its default value. Setting this value to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SpotLightComponent/Shadow/ShadowClippingPlane/fixed(_:)] is equivalent to assigning it to `min(zFar, attenuationRadius)`.

## Configuring the shadow

- **depthBias**: A constant value that RealityKit applies as a bias to its shadow calculations.
- **zNear**: The near-plane of a shadow frustum.
- **cullModeOverride**: The light’s culling mode for shadow map rendering.
